body:
Here is a demo of the problem

```
$ mkdir src
$ mkdir dst
$ tree src
src

0 directories, 0 files
$ mkdir src/a
$ tree src
src
└── a

1 directory, 0 files
$ rclone copy -vv src dst
2017/11/19 20:53:25 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ncw/.rclone.conf"
2017/11/19 20:53:25 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38-148-g07e2e410-vfs-rw" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "src" "dst"]
2017/11/19 20:53:25 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/dst: Modify window is 1ns
2017/11/19 20:53:25 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/dst: Waiting for checks to finish
2017/11/19 20:53:25 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/dst: Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/11/19 20:53:25 INFO  : 
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:          0s

2017/11/19 20:53:25 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 3
2017/11/19 20:53:25 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38-148-g07e2e410-vfs-rw" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "src" "dst"]
$ tree dst/
dst/

0 directories, 0 files
```
Marked. I am writing a [vim-plugin](https://github.com/ipod825/vim-netranger) that requires this bug be fixed.

issue.title: copy: mkdir empty source directories to destination - fixes #1837

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: This PR simply creates empty src directories on the destination. Addresses #1837

body: In light of 74cbdea, this ticket needs reopening.

The `copyto`  command still fails:
```bash
$ rclone --version
rclone v1.42
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1

$ mkdir -p src/a
$ mkdir dst
$ rclone copyto src/a dst/a
$ ls dst
$
```

@ipod825 thanks for the note.

@ishuah actually this seems to all about the root directory because if you replace `rclone copyto src/a dst/a` with `rclone copy src/a dst` it doesn't create dst in the same way.
